title: 983-A
statement: A. Finite or not?time limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou are given several queries. Each query consists of three integers $$$p$$$, $$$q$$$ and $$$b$$$. You need to answer whether the result of $$$p/q$$$ in notation with base $$$b$$$ is a finite fraction.A fraction in notation with base $$$b$$$ is finite if it contains finite number of numerals after the decimal point. It is also possible that a fraction has zero numerals after the decimal point.InputThe first line contains a single integer $$$n$$$ ($$$1 \\le n \\le 10^5$$$) — the number of queries.Next $$$n$$$ lines contain queries, one per line. Each line contains three integers $$$p$$$, $$$q$$$, and $$$b$$$ ($$$0 \\le p \\le 10^{18}$$$, $$$1 \\le q \\le 10^{18}$$$, $$$2 \\le b \\le 10^{18}$$$). All numbers are given in notation with base $$$10$$$.OutputFor each question, in a separate line, printFiniteif the fraction is finite andInfiniteotherwise.ExamplesInput26 12 104 3 10OutputFiniteInfiniteInput41 1 29 36 24 12 33 5 4OutputFiniteFiniteFiniteInfiniteNote$$$\\frac{6}{12} = \\frac{1}{2} = 0,5_{10}$$$$$$\\frac{4}{3} = 1,(3)_{10}$$$$$$\\frac{9}{36} = \\frac{1}{4} = 0,01_2$$$$$$\\frac{4}{12} = \\frac{1}{3} = 0,1_3$$$
